Dreadplague: There's a compact generator and a computer in that 
crate (she pointed a small crate that was marked with 2/3 on it). 
This is one of the three generators needed to power the gun. We need 
you to design a sort of foolproof thing that will allow only preds 
to give that part of power to the gun.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> StarStorm:
> 
> "So... "said the femme "when will start to work"
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > : : SharpClaws/Wolfenstein : :
> > 
> > The two Preds go about their work.
> > 
> > Wolfenstein: All goes well.
> > 
> > 
> > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Dreadplague was on one of the crater's slopes and figured that 
> these 
> > were the coordinates she had seen on the plan. She figured she 
> could 
> > dig with her sword, as her fireballs were simply inappropriate 
for 
> > the rock, but then an idea hit her.
> > 
> > She concentrated and slowly, the slope she was on became darker 
> and 
> > darker, filled at first with shadow, but then with deep ink-like 
> > darkness. She could see nothing, but thought she knew what was 
> going 
> > on. Even the sound could not escape.
> > 
> > When she let go, exhausted, she marvelled at what she had done.
> > 
> > A small opening in the rocky soil, one that tunnelled some feet 
> deep 
> > in the ground, was now before her. All she had to do was to blow 
> it 
> > up to get more space.
> > 
> > She sent the fireball and was soon propelled backward as the 
> > explosion blew the rocks and dust up in the air. She smiled.
> > 
> > Dreadplague: Good! (She turned to her pred colleagues) Hey, 
Preds, 
> > how are you doing?
